page.title: 11FOREST OF DEAN ROAD DEPOT
page.content:
THE ROAD MAINTENANCE DEPOT OF THE F.O.D. (ONE OF FIVE IN GLOUCESTERSHIRE) IS BASED ON AN OLD DEEP MINE SITE, CANNOP COLLIERY. THE AREA IS BORDERED BY THE SEVERN, THE COUNTY BOUNDARY IN THE WEST AND THE A.40 IN THE NORTH.
78 PEOPLE WORK AT THE ROAD MAINTENANCE CENTRE, 68 ROADMEN AND 10 PEOPLE WORKING IN THE OFFICE. SOME STAFF ARE CHARTERED ENGINEERS.
THE CENTRE COVERS 900 MILES OF ROAD.
AT THE CENTRE THEY SPEND Â£1,280,000 ON ROAD BUILDING AND MAINTENANCE. THE COST OF 100 METRES OF ROAD IS Â£30,000. THE COST OF 1000 METRES OF PAVEMENT IS Â£3,000.
